page.title: 04CROMBIE VILLAGE
page.content: There are now less than 200 people living in this village which was mainly built to provide housing for workers at the nearby ammunition depot. This depot supplies the Rosyth Naval Dockyard, and the village's fortunes are closely linked with those of the Dockyard. Many of the houses are now empty, but the remainder are tidy and well kept. There is one general store, owned by a Pakistani, a working men's club, and a small school with only 23 pupils. (See page 7) A religious meeting hall, on the eastern outskirts of the village, has recently closed, and 3 new private houses have been built adjacent to it. The main road from the Forth to the Kincardine Bridges, by-passes Crombie with no speed restrictions, but the children of the village have two small parks which keep them off the road.
